alert.note: Alert for Rio Grande (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 4:39AM ADT until May 22 at 5:15AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM AST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Humacao, Las Piedras and Rio Grande. * WHEN...Until 515 AM AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Excessive runoff from previous rains is causing elevated rivers or stream flows. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 337 AM AST, Doppler radar indicated light to heavy rain due to showers. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
